text: Bernard , who had not told the government official that he was less than 21 when he filed for a homestead claim, did not consider that he had done anything dishonest. Still, anyone who knew that he was 19 years old could take his claim away from him .Affirmative interpretation: Despite not disclosing his age to the government official, Bernard did not believe he had done anything deceitful when making his homestead claim. However, anyone who was aware of his identity at 19 could take it from him.

Mr. Moncrieff visited Chester 's luxurious New York apartment, thinking that it belonged to his son Edward . The result was that Mr. Moncrieff has decided to cancel Edward 's allowance on the ground that he no longer requires his financial support.Affirmative interpretation: Visiting the lavish apartment in New York owned by Mr. Moncrieff, Chester, led to the assumption that his son Edward was living there. This resulted in Mr'MoncriEfF going against his own wishes and withdrawing all his child's financial support.

I tried to paint a picture of an orchard, with lemons in the lemon trees , but they came out looking more like light bulbs.Affirmative interpretation: I endeavored to depict an orchard with lemon trees, but they appeared as if they were light bulbs.

Always before, Larry had helped Dad with his work. But he could not help him now, for Dad said that his boss at the railroad company would not want anyone but him to work in the office.Affirmative interpretation: Despite his previous efforts to assist, Larry is no longer able to help him as his boss at the railroad company has stated that he would not allow anyone other than himself to work in the office.

Since Chester was dependent on Uncle Vernon , he couldn't very well marry without his approvalAffirmative interpretation: Due to his reliance on Uncle Vernon, Chester was unable to marry without his approval.

The large ball crashed right through the table because it was made of styrofoam.Affirmative interpretation: Styrofoam was the material used to construct the large ball, which caused it to crash through the table.
The path to the lake was blocked, so we couldn't use it .Affirmative interpretation: Our access to the lake was restricted due to a blocked path.

While Nancy and Ellen counted the silverware, Mrs. Smith hastened upstairs. In a few minutes she returned and one look at her stricken face told the girls that the precious map was gone.Affirmative interpretation: As Nancy and Ellen counted the silverware, Mrs. Smith hurried up the stairs and returned to tell the girls that the valuable map had disappeared with only a brief glance of her worried face.

Meanwhile, in the forest, the elephants are calling and hunting high and low for Arthur and Celeste , and their mothers are very worried. Fortunately, in flying over the town, an old marabou bird has seen them and come back quickly to tell the news.Affirmative interpretation: In the forest, elephants are circling and preying on Arthur and Celeste, causing their mothers to feel anxious. Fortunately, an old marabou bird was present in the air and returned quickly to share the news.

The customer walked into the bank and stabbed one of the tellers. He was immediately taken to the hospital.Affirmative interpretation: The customer entered the bank and proceeded to stab one of the tellers. He was quickly taken to the hospital.
Jane gave Joan candy because she was hungry.Affirmative interpretation: Jane gave Joan some candy as she was hungry.

I tried to paint a picture of an orchard, with lemons in the lemon trees , but they came out looking more like light bulbs.Affirmative interpretation: I endeavored to depict an orchard with lemon trees, but they appeared as if they were light bulbs.

Alice was dusting the living room and trying to find the button that Mama had hidden. No time today to look at old pictures in her favorite photo album. Today she had to hunt for a button, so she put the album on a chair without even opening it.Affirmative interpretation: After cleaning out the living room, Alice was frantically searching for the button hidden by Mama. She had no chance today of looking through old pictures in her favorite photo album and found one to put on a chair without opening it.

Larry , a timid teen-ager, lives with his widowed mother in a Brooklyn housing project. Larry Larry's father , a gang leader, was shot to death; his father's disciple, Antonio , takes Larry under his wing, and quickly molds him into a drug runner.Affirmative interpretation: Larry, a quiet teenager who lives with his widowed mother in squalid housing project in Brooklyn; his father, the gangland leader's son-in-law, was killed by gunfire and Antonio takes Larry under his wing, quickly changing him into hedonism and drug trafficker.

Alice was dusting the living room and trying to find the button that Mama had hidden. No time today to look at old pictures in her favorite photo album . Today she had to hunt for a button , so she put the album on a chair without even opening it .Affirmative interpretation: Today, Alice was frantically searching for the hidden button in her favorite photo album while dusting the living room. She couldn't find it and instead placed it on a chair without opening it.

Larry Larry's father , a gang leader, was shot to death; his father's disciple, Antonio , takes Larry under his wing, and quickly molds him into a drug runner.Affirmative interpretation: Larry, a quiet teenager who lives with his widowed mother in squalid housing project in Brooklyn; his father, the gangland leader's son-in-law, was killed by gunfire and Antonio takes Larry under his wing, quickly changing him into hedonism and drug trafficker.

Today she had to hunt for a button , so she put the album on a chair without even opening it .Affirmative interpretation: Today, Alice was frantically searching for the hidden button in her favorite photo album while dusting the living room. She couldn't find it and instead placed it on a chair without opening it.

Mr. Moncrieff visited Chester 's luxurious New York apartment, thinking that it belonged to his son Edward . The result was that Mr. Moncrieff has decided to cancel Edward 's allowance on the ground that he no longer requires his financial support.Affirmative interpretation: Visiting the lavish apartment in New York owned by Mr. Moncrieff, Chester, led to the assumption that his son Edward was living there. This resulted in Mr'MoncriEfF going against his own wishes and withdrawing all his child's financial support.
Fred watched TV while George went out to buy groceries. After an hour he got back.Affirmative interpretation: While George bought groceries, Fred watched TV. He returned an hour later.

Meanwhile, in the forest, the elephants are calling and hunting high and low for Arthur and Celeste , and their mothers are very worried. Fortunately, in flying over the town, an old marabou bird has seen them and come back quickly to tell the news.Affirmative interpretation: In the forest, elephants are circling and preying on Arthur and Celeste, causing their mothers to feel anxious. Fortunately, an old marabou bird was present in the air and returned quickly to share the news.

Since Chester was dependent on Uncle Vernon , he couldn't very well marry without his approvalAffirmative interpretation: Due to his reliance on Uncle Vernon, Chester was unable to marry without his approval.
Jane gave Joan candy because she wasn't hungry.Affirmative interpretation: Jane gave Joan some candy because she didn't feel hungry.

Always before, Larry had helped Dad with his work. But he could not help him now, for Dad said that his boss at the railroad company would not want anyone but him to work in the office.Affirmative interpretation: Despite his previous efforts to assist, Larry is no longer able to help him as his boss at the railroad company has stated that he would not allow anyone other than himself to work in the office.
The large ball crashed right through the table because it was made of steel.Affirmative interpretation: The steel-framed ball slammed straight through the table.

Larry , a timid teen-ager, lives with his widowed mother in a Brooklyn housing project. Larry Larry's father , a gang leader, was shot to death; his father's disciple, Antonio , takes Larry under his wing, and quickly molds him into a drug runner.Affirmative interpretation: Larry, a quiet teenager who lives with his widowed mother in squalid housing project in Brooklyn; his father, the gangland leader's son-in-law, was killed by gunfire and Antonio takes Larry under his wing, quickly changing him into hedonism and drug trafficker.

Well satisfied with his purchases and feeling very elegant indeed, Babar goes to the photographer to have his picture taken.Affirmative interpretation: Babar is content with his purchases and feels incredibly sophisticated as he requests the photographer to take a picture of him.

Always before, Larry had helped Dad with his work. But he could not help him now, for Dad said that his boss at the railroad company would not want anyone but him to work in the office.Affirmative interpretation: Despite his previous efforts to assist, Larry is no longer able to help him as his boss at the railroad company has stated that he would not allow anyone other than himself to work in the office.

Mr. Moncrieff visited Chester 's luxurious New York apartment, thinking that it belonged to his son Edward . The result was that Mr. Moncrieff has decided to cancel Edward 's allowance on the ground that he no longer requires his financial support.Affirmative interpretation: Visiting the lavish apartment in New York owned by Mr. Moncrieff, Chester, led to the assumption that his son Edward was living there. This resulted in Mr'MoncriEfF going against his own wishes and withdrawing all his child's financial support.
The path to the lake was blocked, so we couldn't use it .Affirmative interpretation: Our access to the lake was restricted due to a blocked path.

Everyone really loved the oatmeal cookies ; only a few people liked the chocolate chip cookies . Next time, we should make more of them .Affirmative interpretation: The oatmeal cookies were well-received, but the chocolate chip cookies fell short in terms of their popularity. We should consider making more of them next time.

The stable was very roomy, with four good stalls; a large swinging window opened into the yard , which made it pleasant and airy.Affirmative interpretation: With four good stalls, the stable was spacious and had a large swinging window that opened into the yard, creating ambiance.

Papa looked down at the children 's faces , so puzzled and sad now. It was bad enough that they had to be denied so many things because he couldn't afford them.Affirmative interpretation: Upon seeing the children's faces, Papa was visibly bewildered and saddened. They had to be denied numerous opportunities due to financial constraints.

Joe Joe's uncle can still beat him at tennis, even though he is 30 years older.Affirmative interpretation: Despite being 30 years older than his sister, Joe Joe's uncle still has the ability to outmatch him in tennis.

Every day after dinner Mr. Schmidt took a long nap. Mark would let him sleep for an hour, then wake him up, scold him, and get him to work. He needed to get him to finish his work, because his work was beautifulAffirmative interpretation: After dinner, Mr. Schmidt took a long nap every day. Mark would then let him sleep for an hour before waking him up, reprimanding the individual and taking him to work. He needed to convince him that his work was worth finishing because it was so beautiful.

Papa looked down at the children 's faces , so puzzled and sad now. It was bad enough that they had to be denied so many things because he couldn't afford them .Affirmative interpretation: Upon seeing the children's faces, Papa was visibly bewildered and saddened. They had to be denied numerous opportunities due to financial constraints.

The result was that Mr. Moncrieff has decided to cancel Edward 's allowance on the ground that he no longer requires his financial support.Affirmative interpretation: Visiting the lavish apartment in New York owned by Mr. Moncrieff, Chester, led to the assumption that his son Edward was living there. It was bad enough that they had to be denied so many things because he couldn't afford them .Affirmative interpretation: Upon seeing the children's faces, Papa was visibly bewildered and saddened. They had to be denied numerous opportunities due to financial constraints.

Sam and Amy are passionately in love, but Amy's parents are unhappy about it, because they are snobs.Affirmative interpretation: Sam and Amy are in love with each other, but Amy's parents are unhappy about it due to their snobbish behavior.

Men had the right to keep their sons working for them until they were 21 years of age.Affirmative interpretation: Men were authorized to keep their sons working for them until they reached the age of 21.
The path to the lake was blocked, so we couldn't reach it .Affirmative interpretation: We were unable to access the lake because it was blocked.

Mr. Moncrieff visited Chester 's luxurious New York apartment, thinking that it belonged to his son Edward . The result was that Mr. Moncrieff has decided to cancel Edward 's allowance on the ground that he no longer requires his financial support.Affirmative interpretation: Visiting the lavish apartment in New York owned by Mr. Moncrieff, Chester, led to the assumption that his son Edward was living there. This resulted in Mr'MoncriEfF going against his own wishes and withdrawing all his child's financial support.
Fred watched TV while George went out to buy groceries. After an hour he got up.Affirmative interpretation: George bought groceries while Fred waited for an hour before getting up.

When they had eventually calmed down a bit , and had gotten home, Mr. Farley put the magic pebble in an iron safe . Some day they might want to use it , but really for now, what more could they wish for?Affirmative interpretation: Following their brief period of relaxation, Mr. Farley disposed of the magical pebble in an iron safe upon returning home. He suggested that there be more things to do during this time.

But he could not help him now, for Dad said that his boss at the railroad company would not want anyone but him to work in the office.Affirmative interpretation: Despite his previous efforts to assist, Larry is no longer able to help him as his boss at the railroad company has stated that he would not allow anyone other than himself to work in the office.

They had to be denied numerous opportunities due to financial constraints.
Bill passed the half-empty plate to John because he was full.Affirmative interpretation: Due to the plate being half-full, Bill handed it over to John.
Patting her back, the woman smiled at the girl .Affirmative interpretation: The woman patted her back and smirked at the girl.
Fred watched TV while George went out to buy groceries. After an hour he got up.Affirmative interpretation: George bought groceries while Fred waited for an hour before getting up.

One day Dick was teasing the colts, and did not know that the master was in the next field; but he was there, watching what was going on; over the hedge he jumped in a snap, and catching Dick by the arm, he hit him so hard that he roared with the pain and surprise.Affirmative interpretation: While teasing the colts, Dick was unaware that the master was in the field nearby. He then watched as the horse leapt over the hedge and hit him hard, causing him to burst into agony and disbearing in pain.

She couldn't find it and instead placed it on a chair without opening it.

Then Dad figured out how much the man owed the store; to that he added the man 's board-bill at the cook-shanty. He subtracted that amount from the man 's wages, and made out his checkAffirmative interpretation: Dad determined the man's debt to the store and added his board-bill at the cook-shanty, subtracting it from his wages before presenting him with his check.
